silver_hand_questline.name: The Silver Hand
silver_hand_questline.description: A morally grey Old Way order that opposes the Circle's beast-blood leadership. Players can reform it into a restorative force or drive it into purges.

silver_hand_frostroot_contact.name: Frostroot Lodge Contact
silver_hand_frostroot_contact.description: A sealed note draws you to Frostroot Lodge on the Pale border. You are tested as a potential oath-warrior — not for cruelty, but for discipline.
objectives: Travel to Frostroot Lodge (The Pale border)
Meet Hakon Silvershield and hear the Silver Hand's claim to the Old Way
Survive a nonlethal 'Oath Trial' spar (first Mild consequence wins) or pass a discipline test (Will/Physique)
Swear (or refuse) the Silver Hand's Oath of the Five Hundred
rewards: Aspect: 'Oath-Warrior of the Old Way' (1 free invoke)
Access to lodge safehouse and quartermaster

refuse.description: You refuse the Silver Hand's oath. They let you walk — but mark you as watched.

swear.description: You swear the oath and become a Silver Hand oath-warrior.

silver_hand_prove_the_oath.name: Prove the Oath
silver_hand_prove_the_oath.description: To earn trust, you're sent on a hunt that is not simple slaughter: track a cursed creature and decide whether it is a monster or a victim.
objectives: Track a suspected lycanthrope or werebeast incident
Secure conclusive evidence (blood, witness, silver wound, or confession)
Decide: capture for cure (restorer tick) or kill (purger tick)
Return to Frostroot Lodge with proof
rewards: +1 to Silver Hand trust (or +2 if choice aligned with lodge leadership)
Quartermaster reward: silvered weapon or silver bolts (GM pick)
Clock seed: 'Circle Exposure Pressure' (0/6) if pursuing Jorrvaskr links

silver_hand_oath_records.name: The Oath Records
silver_hand_oath_records.description: Inside the lodge lies a record of broken oaths: names, dates, and old Companions who rejected the beast-blood. The lodge wants truth — but truth can be weapon or medicine.
objectives: Study the lodge's Oath Records (Lore/Investigate)
Identify the Silver Hand's origin: a rejected Inner Circle candidate who founded the order
Learn key weaknesses of Circle lycanthropy (silver, fire, shame, cure rites)
Choose how you'll pursue Jorrvaskr: expose and redeem, or purge and replace
rewards: Aspect: 'I Know Where the Rot Began' (1 free invoke)
Unlock branch quest: Restorer vs Purger split

silver_hand_split_restorer_or_purger.name: Restoration or Purge
silver_hand_split_restorer_or_purger.description: The lodge fractures: one side wants to save victims and restore the Companions' oath; the other wants to burn out the beast-blood entirely.
objectives: Attend the lodge council
Choose faction line: restorers or purgers
Undertake a mission proving your chosen line
Prevent internal collapse (extremists may sabotage either path)

restorer.description: You commit to cure-focused hunts and targeted strikes on true monsters only.

purger.description: You commit to extermination. Collateral becomes a moral hazard you must own.

rewards: Restorer: access to cure rites + healer support
Purger: access to heavier silvered kit + strike-team authority

silver_hand_final_judgment.name: Judgment of the Five Hundred
silver_hand_final_judgment.description: The final confrontation: Jorrvaskr cannot remain unchanged. You decide whether the Companions are redeemed, replaced, or destroyed.
objectives: Enter Whiterun Hold with a plan (covert, diplomatic, or assault)
Force the truth of the Circle into the open — privately or publicly
Choose the fate of key Circle members (cure, exile, execution, or alliance)
Resolve the Silver Hand's internal extremists (optional but heavily recommended)
rewards: Major trust gain and leadership influence in Silver Hand
Artifact reward hook (GM: silvered relic tied to Ysgramor's oath)
Campaign consequence: Companions arc altered or terminated
silver_hand_final_judgment.notes: This quest is designed to interface with the Companions finale. If the PC is a lycanthrope, Silver Hand membership should be locked out.
